snippet: Representative Paul D. Ryan’s much-vilified budget proposal is clearly an opening gambit, leaving plenty of room for further hearings and negotiations.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column argues that Rep Paul Ryan's budget plan, which has attracted widespread criticism from the right and the left, is the opening gambit in a grand bipartisan budget compromise that leaves plenty of room for further negotiation; contends that the core components of the plan, tax reform and deficit reduction, have merit.
lead_paragraph: Representative Paul D. Ryan’s much-vilified budget proposal is clearly an opening gambit, leaving plenty of room for further hearings and negotiations.

headline.print_headline: Ryan’s Plan: At Least It’s a Start
headline.seo: Lots of Accolades, but Little Action, on Budget Plan - Common Sense
headline.main: For All the Furor Over Ryan’s Plan, It’s a Place to Start
